intro: Chisocheton novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea chisocheton, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is valued for its ornamental and potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
